channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: XrayGPT: Chest Radiographs Summarization using Medical Vision-Language Models
item.description: The latest breakthroughs in large vision-language models, such as Bard and GPT-4, have showcased extraordinary abilities in performing a wide range of tasks.

item.title: Best-Case Retrieval Evaluation: Improving the Sensitivity of Reciprocal Rank with Lexicographic Precision
item.description: We address the lack of sensitivity of reciprocal rank by introducing and connecting it to the concept of best-case retrieval, an evaluation method focusing on assessing the quality of a ranking for the most satisfied possible user across possible recall requirements.

item.title: WebGLM: Towards An Efficient Web-Enhanced Question Answering System with Human Preferences
item.description: We present WebGLM, a web-enhanced question-answering system based on the General Language Model (GLM).

item.title: Tokenization with Factorized Subword Encoding
item.description: In recent years, language models have become increasingly larger and more complex.

item.title: For Better or Worse: The Impact of Counterfactual Explanations' Directionality on User Behavior in xAI
item.description: However, potential benefits and drawbacks of the directionality of CFEs for user behavior in xAI remain unclear.

item.title: NoCoLA: The Norwegian Corpus of Linguistic Acceptability
item.description: While there has been a surge of large language models for Norwegian in recent years, we lack any tool to evaluate their understanding of grammaticality.

item.title: ReadProbe: A Demo of Retrieval-Enhanced Large Language Models to Support Lateral Reading
item.description: With the rapid growth and spread of online misinformation, people need tools to help them evaluate the credibility and accuracy of online information.

item.title: Taxonomy-Structured Domain Adaptation
item.description: Domain adaptation aims to mitigate distribution shifts among different domains.

item.title: Adaptive Monte Carlo Search for Conjecture Refutation in Graph Theory
item.description: The algorithm is further utilized to refute six open conjectures, two of which were chemical graph theory conjectures formulated by Liu et al. in 2021 and four of which were formulated by the AutoGraphiX computer system in 2006.

item.title: Massively Multilingual Corpus of Sentiment Datasets and Multi-faceted Sentiment Classification Benchmark
item.description: This work presents the most extensive open massively multilingual corpus of datasets for training sentiment models.

item.title: One-for-All: Generalized LoRA for Parameter-Efficient Fine-tuning
item.description: We present Generalized LoRA (GLoRA), an advanced approach for universal parameter-efficient fine-tuning tasks.

item.title: Semi-supervised learning made simple with self-supervised clustering
item.description: Self-supervised learning models have been shown to learn rich visual representations without requiring human annotations.

item.title: PSSTRNet: Progressive Segmentation-guided Scene Text Removal Network
item.description: In each iteration, the original image, previous text removal result, and text mask are input to the network to extract the rest part of the text segments and cleaner text removal result.

item.title: Galactic: Scaling End-to-End Reinforcement Learning for Rearrangement at 100k Steps-Per-Second
item.description: Specifically, a Fetch robot (equipped with a mobile base, 7DoF arm, RGBD camera, egomotion, and onboard sensing) is spawned in a home environment and asked to rearrange objects - by navigating to an object, picking it up, navigating to a target location, and then placing the object at the target location.

item.title: Finding the Missing-half: Graph Complementary Learning for Homophily-prone and Heterophily-prone Graphs
item.description: Real-world graphs generally have only one kind of tendency in their connections.

item.title: Skill Disentanglement for Imitation Learning from Suboptimal Demonstrations
item.description: Imitation learning has achieved great success in many sequential decision-making tasks, in which a neural agent is learned by imitating collected human demonstrations.

item.title: TART: A plug-and-play Transformer module for task-agnostic reasoning
item.description: As such, we focus on the LLM's reasoning abilities and demonstrate that this performance gap exists due to their inability to perform simple probabilistic reasoning tasks.

item.title: Topic-Centric Explanations for News Recommendation
item.description: News recommender systems (NRS) have been widely applied for online news websites to help users find relevant articles based on their interests.

item.title: Additive Causal Bandits with Unknown Graph
item.description: We explore algorithms to select actions in the causal bandit setting where the learner can choose to intervene on a set of random variables related by a causal graph, and the learner sequentially chooses interventions and observes a sample from the interventional distribution.

item.title: Generated Graph Detection
item.description: Graph generative models become increasingly effective for data distribution approximation and data augmentation.

item.title: Modality Adaption or Regularization? A Case Study on End-to-End Speech Translation
item.description: Pre-training and fine-tuning is a paradigm for alleviating the data scarcity problem in end-to-end speech translation (E2E ST).

item.title: Localization of Just Noticeable Difference for Image Compression
item.description: By applying this framework, we created a novel PJND dataset, KonJND++, consisting of 300 source images, compressed versions thereof under JPEG or BPG compression, and an average of 43 ratings of PJND and 129 self-reported locations of JND-critical regions for each source image.

item.title: Rank-Aware Negative Training for Semi-Supervised Text Classification
item.description: To alleviate the noisy information, we adapt a reasoning with uncertainty-based approach to rank the unlabeled texts based on the evidential support received from the labeled texts.

item.title: Von Mises Mixture Distributions for Molecular Conformation Generation
item.description: The resulting distribution on geometries $p(x)$ is known as the Boltzmann distribution, and many molecular properties are expectations computed under this distribution.

item.title: Differentiating Metropolis-Hastings to Optimize Intractable Densities
item.description: When performing inference on probabilistic models, target densities often become intractable, necessitating the use of Monte Carlo samplers.

item.title: Question Decomposition Tree for Answering Complex Questions over Knowledge Bases
item.description: To verify that QDT can enhance KBQA task, we design a decomposition-based KBQA system called QDTQA.

item.title: Large Language Models Sometimes Generate Purely Negatively-Reinforced Text
item.description: When using adversarial training, it is common practice to train against the most egregious failures.

item.title: DenseLight: Efficient Control for Large-scale Traffic Signals with Dense Feedback
item.description: 1) The travel time of a vehicle is delayed feedback on the effectiveness of TSC policy at each traffic intersection since it is obtained after the vehicle has left the road network.

item.title: SRATTA : Sample Re-ATTribution Attack of Secure Aggregation in Federated Learning
item.description: We consider a cross-silo federated learning (FL) setting where a machine learning model with a fully connected first layer is trained between different clients and a central server using FedAvg, and where the aggregation step can be performed with secure aggregation (SA).

item.title: Using a neural network approach to accelerate disequilibrium chemistry calculations in exoplanet atmospheres
item.description: Our results show that in 90% of the cases, the fully trained model is able to predict the evolved mixing ratios of the species in the hot-Jupiter atmosphere simulations.

item.title: The Effect of Masking Strategies on Knowledge Retention by Language Models
item.description: To foster reproducibility, the code, as well as the data used in this paper, are openly available.

item.title: Weakly-Supervised Scientific Document Classification via Retrieval-Augmented Multi-Stage Training
item.description: To address this challenge, we propose a weakly-supervised approach for scientific document classification using label names only.

item.title: Coupled Attention Networks for Multivariate Time Series Anomaly Detection
item.description: To address this issue, we propose a coupled attention-based neural network framework (CAN) for anomaly detection in multivariate time series data featuring dynamic variable relationships.

item.title: H-SLAM: Hybrid Direct-Indirect Visual SLAM
item.description: The recent success of hybrid methods in monocular odometry has led to many attempts to generalize the performance gains to hybrid monocular SLAM.

item.title: When Vision Fails: Text Attacks Against ViT and OCR
item.description: While text-based machine learning models that operate on visual inputs of rendered text have become robust against a wide range of existing attacks, we show that they are still vulnerable to visual adversarial examples encoded as text.

item.title: Benchmarking Neural Network Training Algorithms
item.description: In order to address these challenges, we introduce a new, competitive, time-to-result benchmark using multiple workloads running on fixed hardware, the AlgoPerf: Training Algorithms benchmark.

item.title: Unprocessing Seven Years of Algorithmic Fairness
item.description: Unprocessing allows for a direct comparison of methods using different underlying models and levels of relaxation.

item.title: Unveiling the Hessian's Connection to the Decision Boundary
item.description: Based on this finding, we provide a new and straightforward approach to studying the complexity of a high-dimensional decision boundary; show that this connection naturally inspires a new generalization measure; and finally, we develop a novel margin estimation technique which, in combination with the generalization measure, precisely identifies minima with simple wide-margin boundaries.

item.title: Mitigating Transformer Overconfidence via Lipschitz Regularization
item.description: Though Transformers have achieved promising results in many computer vision tasks, they tend to be over-confident in predictions, as the standard Dot Product Self-Attention (DPSA) can barely preserve distance for the unbounded input domain.

item.title: Tuning Legged Locomotion Controllers via Safe Bayesian Optimization
item.description: In this paper, we present a data-driven strategy to simplify the deployment of model-based controllers in legged robotic hardware platforms.

item.title: FIRE: An Optimization Approach for Fast Interpretable Rule Extraction
item.description: We present FIRE, Fast Interpretable Rule Extraction, an optimization-based framework to extract a small but useful collection of decision rules from tree ensembles.

item.title: LIVABLE: Exploring Long-Tailed Classification of Software Vulnerability Types
item.description: (2) adaptive re-weighting module, which adjusts the learning weights for different types according to the training epochs and numbers of associated samples by a novel training loss.

item.title: The Devil is in the Details: On the Pitfalls of Event Extraction Evaluation
item.description: In this paper, we check the reliability of EE evaluations and identify three major pitfalls: (1) The data preprocessing discrepancy makes the evaluation results on the same dataset not directly comparable, but the data preprocessing details are not widely noted and specified in papers.

item.title: Izindaba-Tindzaba: Machine learning news categorisation for Long and Short Text for isiZulu and Siswati
item.description: Due to the shortage of data for these native South African languages, the datasets that were created were augmented and oversampled to increase data size and overcome class classification imbalance.

item.title: Learning Multilingual Sentence Representations with Cross-lingual Consistency Regularization
item.description: Multilingual sentence representations are the foundation for similarity-based bitext mining, which is crucial for scaling multilingual neural machine translation (NMT) system to more languages.

item.title: When Do Annotator Demographics Matter? Measuring the Influence of Annotator Demographics with the POPQUORN Dataset
item.description: Further, our work shows that backgrounds not previously considered in NLP (e. g., education), are meaningful and should be considered.

item.title: Waffling around for Performance: Visual Classification with Random Words and Broad Concepts
item.description: In this work, we study this behavior in detail and propose \texttt{Waffle}CLIP, a framework for zero-shot visual classification which achieves similar performance gains on a large number of visual classification tasks by simply replacing LLM-generated descriptors with random character and word descriptors \textbf{without} querying external models.

item.title: Transcendental Idealism of Planner: Evaluating Perception from Planning Perspective for Autonomous Driving
item.description: Evaluating the performance of perception modules in autonomous driving is one of the most critical tasks in developing the complex intelligent system.

item.title: Augmenting Language Models with Long-Term Memory
item.description: Such a decoupled memory design can easily cache and update long-term past contexts for memory retrieval without suffering from memory staleness.

item.title: Efficiently Learning the Graph for Semi-supervised Learning
item.description: We further show how to approximately learn the best graphs from the sparse families efficiently using the conjugate gradient method.
